messages: 70671271258b9615e98e5cecb81cdf70 (05:00): Could someone tell me how I can get these two items side by side in Firefox AND IE? : http://pastebin.com/740369
70671271258b9615e98e5cecb81cdf70 (05:01): I'm a second from scrapping div's and just laying in a table.. I'm spending too much time on this.
df52db578d711579b9cc26c94d8b3d41 (05:01): [Thom]: float: left
df52db578d711579b9cc26c94d8b3d41 (05:02): on the items that need to be next to each other
df52db578d711579b9cc26c94d8b3d41 (05:03): That paste looks like a list to me
df52db578d711579b9cc26c94d8b3d41 (05:03): Why not use one. and make the images backgrounds instead
70671271258b9615e98e5cecb81cdf70 (05:04): Use <ul> you mean?
70671271258b9615e98e5cecb81cdf70 (05:04): and the text will be <li> ?
df52db578d711579b9cc26c94d8b3d41 (05:05): and each li has an id which you use to set the image as background
70671271258b9615e98e5cecb81cdf70 (05:06): Won't the text be on top of the image if the image is set to be a background?
df52db578d711579b9cc26c94d8b3d41 (05:06): not if you put some padding on the list item as well
70671271258b9615e98e5cecb81cdf70 (05:08): How do I get those <li> items next to eachother instead of on top of eachother?
7861457b3f716c95ced114fde2cdd325 (05:09): thom: you mean you want yahoo finance and yahoo music next to eachother?
df52db578d711579b9cc26c94d8b3d41 (05:09): float them
49ec94fc4c90faefd08e2ce20017e132 (05:09): Something: inline;
49ec94fc4c90faefd08e2ce20017e132 (05:09): I wish I remembered this.
7861457b3f716c95ced114fde2cdd325 (05:09): it's display: inline
49ec94fc4c90faefd08e2ce20017e132 (05:09): There you go.
df52db578d711579b9cc26c94d8b3d41 (05:10): [Thom]: Something like this? http://fumle.dk/public/webdev/thom/
df52db578d711579b9cc26c94d8b3d41 (05:11): You probably want them to be links
49ec94fc4c90faefd08e2ce20017e132 (05:11): Mmm. I need to freaking fix this client's site.
df52db578d711579b9cc26c94d8b3d41 (05:11): Just add an anchor, and set the background on the anchor instead. That way the image will be clickable as well
70671271258b9615e98e5cecb81cdf70 (05:11): No I want the text underneath them.
49ec94fc4c90faefd08e2ce20017e132 (05:11): But I need to move all the files and SQL DB to a new server.
49ec94fc4c90faefd08e2ce20017e132 (05:11): Re-upload all the files individually.
49ec94fc4c90faefd08e2ce20017e132 (05:11): ANd then re-make the layout.
70671271258b9615e98e5cecb81cdf70 (05:12): Munter: The text is supposed to be a description.
df52db578d711579b9cc26c94d8b3d41 (05:12): [Thom]: oh, then you need images. and add the title attibute. Thats the description
70671271258b9615e98e5cecb81cdf70 (05:14): okay let me try that.
70671271258b9615e98e5cecb81cdf70 (05:17): is it imposible to do it with just div tags?
70671271258b9615e98e5cecb81cdf70 (05:17): I won't always know how big the image is going to be so a background isn't going to work.
70671271258b9615e98e5cecb81cdf70 (05:17): that title attribute didn't work on my machine and besides, I need to style that text
df52db578d711579b9cc26c94d8b3d41 (05:25): The title attribute works, but you cant style it.
df52db578d711579b9cc26c94d8b3d41 (05:26): To do what you want, you need javascript. At least if you want it working in IE as well
df52db578d711579b9cc26c94d8b3d41 (05:26): good night

ede4b9c1dd03e4be30d697e4f9f8df63 (06:05): I have 2 css sheets, one overrides info from the first one, this works fine on one page but on another page, the second css sheet (with overrides) isnt being applied, any idea what might cause this?

02ef7ce1bb30b06a930e1d1ea2f8771d (06:16): Bleh, I am trying to create a site ... and I am making a form with something like this ... <form><div><label>Name</label><input type="text" name="Name"></div></form> ... for some darn reason, I can't set the width on label. Any ideas on why I can't do this?
bc09deb8e9a2f5692a7def2ab1773ec7 (06:18): use <div style="float:left; width:Npx">Name</div><div><input... /></div>
558848280fb221d89a4e69527ff5d4a9 (06:19): foo: you can only set widths on block elements, so, you can set display: block; on the label, then give it a width.
bc09deb8e9a2f5692a7def2ab1773ec7 (06:20): <div> is display:block; per default, you don't need <label>
558848280fb221d89a4e69527ff5d4a9 (06:20): foo: this might be of soem help: http://www.quirksmode.org/css/forms.html
bc09deb8e9a2f5692a7def2ab1773ec7 (06:20): *by default
558848280fb221d89a4e69527ff5d4a9 (06:20): Mahadeva: right, but label is better.
bc09deb8e9a2f5692a7def2ab1773ec7 (06:20): why?
558848280fb221d89a4e69527ff5d4a9 (06:20): Because that's what label elements are for.
558848280fb221d89a4e69527ff5d4a9 (06:21): semantically better, screen readers work better, some browsers will set the focus to the input when you click the label, etc.
02ef7ce1bb30b06a930e1d1ea2f8771d (06:21): Flannel: right. I had <label> to set a width ... so I could have the text in there ... and the form inputs line up, and the text all looks nice and even
558848280fb221d89a4e69527ff5d4a9 (06:22): Mahadeva: for the same reasons you use <h#> instead of <div>s
bc09deb8e9a2f5692a7def2ab1773ec7 (06:23): yes, you're right
bc09deb8e9a2f5692a7def2ab1773ec7 (06:24): well... different ways to do the same, but you should do what Flannel says
02ef7ce1bb30b06a930e1d1ea2f8771d (06:26): Flannel: ah, I should be using h# instead of label.
02ef7ce1bb30b06a930e1d1ea2f8771d (06:27): Flannel: oh, ok /me checks out that site
ff2a89295af0677aaab0f3b956db3548 (06:48): fucking IE
6cc33fc59f5834698e673094ecaae5f8 (06:55): Jet2k5, you'd probably catch some horrible virus if you tried that with IE ;)
